lom:description.lom:string: Though useful for reference, this site is best as a science "free-for-all." Used, possibly, for students that have finished work early, or in small groups, working on any of the on-line activities. Webcasts could be used in classrooms as supplements to regular lessons.

The home page of one of the greatest science learning museums in the United States. High quality, on-line activities, science news, and essays. * Origins - Exploring CERN, the worlds largest particle accelerator * Live webcasts - lectures, experiments, collection of archived webcasts * The Brain explorer - activites exploring perception * Science wire - news articles on latest science * The Learning studio - interactive exhibits, and activities * Observatory - astronomical information * Sport science - science concepts using sports examples * Solar max - a page dedicated to the sun (and 2000's solar maximum)

lom:keyword.lom:string: science museums, science activities, science education, astronomy, biology, perception, particle accelerators

lom:title.lom:string: Exploratorium: the museum of science, art, and human perception
